Detailed Description

This singleton class keeps track of and loads ManagedTextures.

bool Moo::TextureManager::convertToDDS ( const std::string &  originalName,
const std::string &  ddsName,
D3DFORMAT  format 
) [static]

This method converts a texture file to a .dds.

If there is a .dds file there already, this method will get the format from the current dds if not it will compress .tgas to dxt3 and .bmps to dxt1.

Parameters:
originalName the file to convert.
ddsName the file to convert to.
format D3D surface format to use when performing the conversion.
Returns:
true if the operation is successful.

)

allowAnimation can the texture be animated?
mustExist must the texture exist?
allocator the owner of this texture
Returns:
pointer to the loaded texture

void Moo::TextureManager::initDetailLevels ( DataSectionPtr  pDetailLevels,
bool  accumulate = false 
)

This method inits the texture detail levels used by the texture manager.

If no section or an empty section is passed in, default detail levels will be used.

Parameters:
pDetailLevels the datasection to initialise the detail levels from.

bool Moo::TextureManager::isTextureFile ( const std::string &  resourceID  )  const

This method does a quick check to see if the resource is a texture file.

It does this by checking that the file exists and has a valid texture extension.

Parameters:
resourceID The name of the texture to test.
Returns:
True if the resource is a texture, false otherwise.

const std::string & Moo::TextureManager::notFoundBmp (  )  [static]

Static method to return the default texture used as a fallback for missing textures.

void Moo::TextureManager::recalculateDDSFiles (  ) 

This method changes the current texture detail level of the game.

First set the appropriate values in the appropriate xml file, then call this method at runtime to reload all textures.

Release all textures.

This method reloads all the textures used from disk.

void Moo::TextureManager::reloadMipMaps ( ProgessFunc  progFunc  ) 

void Moo::TextureManager::setFormat ( const std::string &  fileName,
D3DFORMAT  format 
)

Sets the texture format to be used when loading the specified texture.

This format will override all information defined in a texformat file or in the global texture_detail_levels file. Other fields, such as formatCompressed, lodMode, will be set to their default values. Call this function before loading the texture for the first time. The format will not be changed if the texture has already been loaded.

Also, this function will not work if the texture has already been converted into a DDS in the filesystem. For this reason, when using this function, make sure this same format is used when batch converting this texture map for deployment (in the absence of the original file, the format used to write the DDS will be the one used).

Parameters:
fileName full pach to the texture whose format should be set set this will be used like the contains field of the texture_detail_levels, potentially affecting more files if the file name provided is not the fullpath.
format the texture format to be used.

const TextureMap& Moo::TextureManager::textureMap (  )  const [inline]

uint32 Moo::TextureManager::textureMemoryUsed (  )  const

This method returns total texture memory used in bytes.

const char ** Moo::TextureManager::validTextureExtensions (  )  [static]

bool Moo::TextureManager::writeDDS ( DX::BaseTexture *  texture,
const std::string &  ddsName,
D3DFORMAT  format,
int  numDestMipLevels = 0 
) [static]

This method saves a dds file from a texture.

Parameters:
texture the DX::BaseTexture to save out (important has to be 32bit colour depth.
ddsName the filename to save the file to.
format the TF_format to save the file in.
numDestMipLevels Number of Mip levels to save in the DDS.
Returns:
true if the function succeeds.
